title: RJD delegation meets ECI full bench, discusses SIR
content: RJD Rajya Sabha MP Manoj Jha said they discussed the SIR in detail and were assured by the poll panel that they will make the procedure simpler and bring more transparency

title: CPI conference calls for united front against Centre’s financial curbs
content: The CPI meet observed that it is a matter of pride that Kerala is moving forward by increasing its own revenue despite the continued financial curbs by the Union government.

title: Researchers tap into wound-healing property of red ivy plant
content: They develop a multi-layered wound pad with acteoside molecule derived from the plant as the key ingredient

title: Assam military garrison hoists tallest Tricolour in northeast
content: The National Flag on a 108-foot-high mast fluttered above the treeline at Tezpur, headquarters of the Army’s 4 Corps

title: Will give more explosive proof of vote theft in future: Rahul Gandhi
content: The Congress leader said, “Elections have been stolen in Maharashtra, Haryana and Karnataka. We have given black-and-white proof. In the coming times, we will give more dynamic, explosive proof”

title: Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu prioritises Uttarandhra Sujala Sravanthi, Srisailam Dam protection works
content: CM Chandrababu Naidu said these projects were vital for safeguarding Andhra Pradesh’s long-term water security

title: Filmmaker Ajay Govind on his short film ‘Basanti Tailors’, set to be screened at the Chicago South Asian Film Festival 2025
content: Basanti Tailors, which premiered at the Bengaluru International Short Film Festival 2025 in August, explores the idea of recycling from rural and urban perspectives

title: Firos says he will soon expose scam involving Jaleel, dismisses allegations related to “illegal business”
content: MYL leader says he is a businessman and none of his activities are illegal. Jaleel had recently raised doubts about Firos being engaged in dubious ‘hawala’ transactions through a Dubai-based company

title: PILs in Bombay High Court challenge Maratha-Kunbi certificate order
content: Petitioners call Government Resolution enabling members of Maratha community to obtain Kunbi caste certificates as political, arbitrary, and beyond State’s legal authority

title: Court junks plea alleging forgery in inclusion of Sonia Gandhi's name in electoral roll
content: On September 10, senior advocate Pavan Narang, appearing for the complainant, Vikas Tripathi, said in January 1980 Ms. Gandhi’s name was added as a voter of New Delhi constituency when she was not an Indian citizen

title: Plea in Madras High Court seeks CBI probe into alleged disproportionate assets of Ramanathapuram MP Navaskani
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan order notice to the CBI on the PIL plea filed by an advocate from Tirunelveli district

title: Five-year-old girl on way to school slips into open manhole, escapes unhurt; GHMC blames HYDRAA
content: An enquiry into the incident by GHMC reportedly revealed that the manhole cover was removed by HYDRAA forces

title: Madras High Court dismisses plea challenging appointment of Venkatraman as Tamil Nadu DGP in-charge
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan say some ad hoc arrangement must be made until the appointment of a regular DGP

title: UTMB 2025: Guntur’s Viswabharath Allamsetti on his journey to finishing world’s toughest ultramarathon
content: Guntur-born runner Viswabharath Allamsetti balances family, work and relentless training to conquer the world’s toughest trail ultramarathon

title: MLA Mehraj Malik’s detention: AAP MP Sanjay Singh ‘disallowed’ to register protest in Srinagar
content: The AAP was planning to address a press conference and hold a protest against the detention of Mehraj Malik. Meanwhile, a blast was reported in Doda amid unrest

title: Delhi HC protects Aishwarya Rai Bachchan’s personality rights against AI misuse, unauthorised products
content: In an order passed on September 9, Justice Tejas Karia said the unauthorised use of a celebrity’s likeness without consent not only causes commercial harm but also undermines their right to privacy and dignity

title: T.N. Rising conclave in Hosur secures ₹26,000 crore in investments
content: Set against the backdrop of the Chief Minister’s return from his T.N. Rising Europe tour, Mr. Stalin said the investments secured here surpassed the ₹15,516 crore raised from abroad. “We are beating our own record just three days after returning,” he said

title: Kerala MLA M.K. Muneer in critical care after cardiac arrest
content: Cardiac arrest caused by hypokalemia, a dangerously low level of potassium in blood. While Muneer’s condition remains critical, hospital authorities confirm he is stable and responding positively to treatment

title: SpiceJet's Kathmandu-bound plane faces suspected tailpipe fire at Delhi airport
content: A jet engine tailpipe fire, also referred to as an internal fire, occurs within the normal gas flow path of the engine

title: Subrahmanya Road passenger train to run with electric loco from September 15
content: Two round trips between Mangaluru Central and Kabaka Puttur were extended till Subrahmanya Road on April 12

title: Gujarat Governor Acharya Devvrat given additional charge of Maharashtra as C.P. Radhakrishnan demits office
content: Maharashtra Governor C.P. Radhakrishnan demitted office on Thursday due to his election as the country's next Vice President

title: Bhopal’s ‘90-degree’ bridge has a turn of 118-119 degrees, expert tells High Court
content: In view of the latest findings, the Madhya Pradesh government has sought time from the court to reconsider its decision against a firm it had blacklisted in connection with the controversial structure

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan urges NHAI to expedite works on national highways
content: Chief Minister says though NHAI is ‘generally doing commendable work in Kerala, there is a standstill in works in some regions’

title: 11 migrant workers stranded in Oman, MEA urged to bring them back home
content: The workers are due four months’ salary, additional pay for their extra hours and at present have been thrown out of their official accommodation.

title: Watch: Haunting moment Charlie Kirk said 'some gun deaths are worth it'
content: At 31, his career ended in the most violent way possible. A sniper’s bullet struck him in the neck as he spoke to students at Utah Valley University. The rally turned into chaos. Within hours, Kirk was gone.

title: Gen Z group, army discuss roadmap for provisional government- Who will be interim PM
content: Following Prime Minister Oli's resignation amid protests, Gen Z protesters are in talks with Nepal's President and Army Chief to form an interim government. Chief Justice Sushila Karki, Kathmandu Mayor Balendra Shah, and others are being considered to lead the caretaker government, tasked with overseeing fresh elections. Discussions continue to navigate the political transition and maintain order.

title: Sonia Gandhi voter roll row: Delhi court dismisses plea seeking action
content: A Delhi court has dismissed a plea seeking action against Congress leader Sonia Gandhi over allegations regarding her inclusion in the electoral rolls before she became an Indian citizen. The complainant, Vikas Tripathi, argued that Gandhi's name was added to the New Delhi constituency's voter list in 1980, prior to her citizenship in 1983.

title: Former Tesla employee shares meeting ‘ground rules’ with Elon Musk; CEO responds
content: Former Tesla employee Russell Varone shared meeting ground rules with Elon Musk, emphasizing efficiency and action. Musk humorously responded, showing flexibility on the no-food rule, potentially influenced by studies on cognitive function. Briefly, Larry Ellison surpassed Musk as the world's richest person due to Oracle's success, fueled by a major deal with OpenAI and significant cloud contracts.

title: IND vs PAK: Ex-Pakistan captain reveals why buzz is missing – 'No hype'
content: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif suggested India's easy agreement to play Pakistan in the Asia Cup has diminished the usual excitement surrounding the match. He contrasted this with past encounters where obstacles heightened anticipation, noting high ticket prices as a contributing factor to the subdued build-up. Despite this, he anticipated the match would gain momentum closer to the date.

title: Manipur: 43 BJP members quit in Phungyar, days before PM Modi’s likely visit
content: Ahead of Prime Minister Modi's anticipated visit to Manipur, 43 BJP members in Ukhrul district resigned, citing a lack of inclusiveness and respect for grassroots leadership. This mass resignation occurs against the backdrop of ongoing ethnic tensions between Meitei and Kuki-Zo communities.

title: IND vs PAK tickets: ECB denies sluggish sales; says response encouraging
content: The Emirates Cricket Board (ECB) dismissed reports of sluggish India-Pakistan ticket sales, confirming strong demand. An ECB official said 3,000 Platinum List tickets released online sold out within minutes, underlining the massive fan interest for Sunday’s high-stakes Dubai clash.

title: Remote phone-locking: RBI may have ‘new’ plan to cut bad loans
content: The Reserve Bank of India is considering allowing lenders to remotely lock mobile phones of borrowers who default on EMI payments. This move aims to reduce bad debt but raises consumer rights concerns. The RBI will update its Fair Practices Code, requiring lenders to obtain consent and prohibiting access to personal data.

title: Gemini app tops 10M users: Nano Banana fuels buzz; viral prompts to try
content: Google's Gemini app, featuring the AI image editing tool Nano Banana, has achieved over 10 million downloads shortly after its launch. Users have already created or modified over 200 million images, leveraging Nano Banana's speed and accuracy. Viral trends showcase the tool's versatility, allowing users to transform themselves into action figures, appear in different decades, and step into famous artworks.

title: UK PM removes Mandelson as US ambassador over fresh Epstein revelations
content: UK Prime Minister ousted Peter Mandelson as Ambassador to the US after emails revealed a deeper relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence suggested Mandelson defended Epstein's initial conviction, a stance undisclosed during his appointment. The sacking followed reports by The Sun and Bloomberg detailing supportive messages sent to Epstein during a 2008 investigation.

title: Vanessa Bryant steps up: fulfills godmother role; sends birthday wishes to Ellie
content: Vanessa Bryant celebrated Pau Gasol's daughter Ellie's 5th birthday with a heartfelt Instagram story, showcasing the enduring bond between the two families. Gasol, touched by the gesture, praised Vanessa as the "Best God Mother!" Their connection, forged during their time with the Lakers, has deepened over the years, with Gasol now a pillar of support for the Bryant family.

title: Dwyane Wade’s wife Gabrielle Union: craving wild nights; couple sings, grooves
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union were spotted enjoying a lively night out with friends, filled with karaoke, singing, and dancing. Union shared glimpses of their fun-filled evening on Instagram, expressing her desire for more such moments. The couple, who recently celebrated their 11th anniversary, were seen attending a football match before heading to the after-party.

title: Karisma legal battle: Lawyer calls Rs 30,000 cr estate claim 'media fabrication'
content: The battle over late Sunjay Kapur's wealth escalates. His children and mother challenge the will. They allege forgery by his widow, Priya Sachdeva Kapur. Sunjay's sister, Mandhira Kapur Smith, supports the children. She questions the will's validity. Karisma Kapoor's lawyer clarifies the focus is on securing the children's inheritance. The family disputes the reported estate value.

title: 200 flyers left sweating on Singapore-bound Air India flight; stranded inside for 2hrs
content: Over 200 passengers on an Air India flight to Singapore faced a distressing ordeal at Delhi airport. Due to malfunctioning air conditioning and electrical systems on Wednesday night, passengers were stuck inside the Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner for nearly two hours. The discomfort led to passengers using newspapers as fans before being deplaned.

title: 'Never understand USA': Faf baffled after Kirk's assassination; 'can have a gun'
content: Political activist Charlie Kirk was fatally shot at Utah Valley University during his comeback tour, prompting a widespread search for the shooter. The incident has sparked reactions, including from Donald Trump, who lamented it as a "dark moment." Ex South Africa skipper Faf du Plessis voiced concerns about American gun laws.

title: 'Multiple active crime scenes': Who killed Charlie Kirk? Police widen search for sniper
content: Charlie Kirk was fatally shot while addressing a crowd at Utah Valley University, prompting an intense manhunt for the rooftop sniper. The conservative activist was answering questions about gun violence when the incident occurred, leading to a campus lockdown. Authorities are actively investigating multiple crime scenes and have questioned, then released, two individuals initially detained.

title: HDFC: Multiple services to be unavailable for several hours on September 13 - check details
content: HDFC Bank will conduct scheduled maintenance on September 13th, 2025, from 12:30 AM to 7:30 AM IST to enhance system performance. During this period, NetBanking, MobileBanking, UPI services, and some ATM/debit card functionalities will be unavailable. Customers are advised to use PayZapp Wallet for uninterrupted payments, while credit card services will remain largely operational.

title: Aishwarya Rai personality rights case: HC orders takedown of unauthorized content featuring actor
content: The Delhi High Court has granted Aishwarya Rai Bachchan interim relief in a case concerning the unauthorized use of her name, image, and persona on digital platforms, including AI-generated content. The court directed platforms, e-commerce sites, and Google to remove infringing content and block specified URLs within 72 hours. Read on.

title: World Athletics C'ships 2025: India’s full squad and complete schedule in Tokyo
content: India is sending a 19-member squad, spearheaded by javelin star Neeraj Chopra, to the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo from September 13-21. Chopra aims to defend his title, and history will be made with four Indian men competing in the javelin event. Sprinter Animesh Kujur is also set to become the first Indian to participate in the men’s 200m.

title: 'Vote-chori slogan spreading like fire': Rahul vows 'explosive' proof; slams NDA
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has promised to reveal "dynamic and explosive" evidence of vote theft, alleging the NDA government was formed through stolen votes. He claims to have proof of manipulation, particularly highlighting the "Gujarat model" as a scheme for electoral fraud involving PM Modi, Amit Shah, and the Election Commission.

title: $4 bn P-8I defence deal: US team may come to India; talks amid fresh trade ties push
content: Amidst ongoing India-US trade discussions, a US delegation comprising defence officials and Boeing representatives is expected to visit India next week. They will discuss a $4 billion deal for six P-8I naval patrol aircraft, a deal that had previously stalled.

title: Scientists detect ‘geological heartbeat’ that can split Africa and create a new ocean
content: Beneath eastern Africa, scientists have discovered a dramatic geological process driven by rhythmic pulses of molten rock rising from the Earth's mantle. This "geological heartbeat" weakens the crust, causing earthquakes and volcanic activity. Over millions of years, this process is expected to split Africa into two parts, creating a new ocean basin and reshaping the continent.

title: 'Israel did what US did': Netanyahu defends Qatar strike with 9/11 analogy – watch
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu defended the military strike on Hamas leaders in Doha, Qatar, likening it to America's response to 9/11. He asserted that nations shouldn't harbor terrorists and Israel will act against those who do.

title: Aishwarya Rai gets relief: Delhi HC bars misuse of name, photos
content: The Delhi High Court has come down heavily on the unauthorized use of Bollywood actor Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's name, image, and persona, holding that such exploitation without consent not only causes commercial detriment but also impacts her dignity and reputation.

title: Delhi-Kathmandu SpiceJet flight delayed: Passengers exit sweltering cabin
content: SpiceJet passengers on a Delhi-Kathmandu flight faced discomfort after a technical snag caused air conditioning failure, leading to delays and eventual disembarkation. This incident follows a similar Air India ordeal where over 200 Singapore-bound passengers were stranded in a malfunctioning Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner for two hours.

title: Solar eclipse 2025: When is Surya Grahan in September and will it be visible in India?
content: September 2025 features a rare celestial double feature: a dramatic lunar eclipse on the 7th and a partial solar eclipse on the 21st. The solar eclipse, dubbed the "equinox eclipse," will be visible at sunrise in the Southern Hemisphere, particularly in New Zealand, eastern Australia, and parts of the South Pacific.

title: Asia Cup | More than just cricket! Gill hugged UAE player after hitting winning runs
content: In a heartwarming reunion at the Asia Cup 2025, Shubman Gill, India's rising cricket star, shared a special moment with UAE's Simranjeet Singh. Years ago, Simranjeet had bowled to a young Gill in Mohali. After Gill sealed India's victory with a boundary off Simranjeet's bowling, he embraced his former practice partner.

title: Tyreek Hill under NFL probe: Conduct policy review begins as new accusations surface
content: The National Football League is reviewing domestic violence allegations against Tyreek Hill. These allegations came from Hill's estranged wife. The league's decision depends on her cooperation. Miami Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel acknowledged the matter. Hill's past includes a domestic assault case. His attorney denies the new allegations. This case could impact NFL trade rumors.

title: 'Match must go on': SC refuses urgent hearing of PIL; India vs Pak to continue
content: The Supreme Court refused to urgently list a PIL seeking to cancel the India vs. Pakistan cricket match scheduled for the Asia Cup in Dubai. The petition, filed by law students, cited recent political tensions and terror attacks, arguing the match would compromise national dignity.

title: CRPF flags Rahul Gandhi’s foreign trips, cites serious security concerns
content: The CRPF has expressed worries about repeated security protocol breaches by Rahul Gandhi during his international travels, potentially increasing his risk exposure. Despite having Z+ security cover, Gandhi has reportedly skipped necessary safety measures on multiple occasions. The CRPF has urged adherence to security guidelines, emphasizing that violations weaken VVIP protection.

title: Cash, beaker set, motherboard seized: ISIS-inspired module busted; suspects were planning 'IED attacks'
content: Delhi Police have reportedly dismantled an 'IS-inspired' module, arresting suspects across Delhi, Ranchi, and Mumbai. The suspects were allegedly planning IED attacks to establish an Islamic Caliphate. Authorities seized bomb-making materials, including chemicals and electronic components. Investigations suggest an ISI operative posed as an IS recruiter, guiding the suspects through encrypted apps.

title: Parents shield kids, students scatter — Video shows chaos as Charlie Kirk shot on stage
content: During a "Prove Me Wrong" event at Utah University, right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was shot, causing widespread panic. The incident occurred while Kirk addressed a question about transgender mass shooting suspects, turning a campus debate into a scene of terror. Witnesses described the chaos as attendees scrambled for safety, highlighting concerns about security at the event.

title: Why an India vs Pakistan final has never happened in Asia Cup
content: The highly anticipated India-Pakistan cricket clash at the Asia Cup 2025 in Dubai on September 14 is generating immense excitement. Historically, India has dominated high-stakes encounters, particularly in ICC tournaments and Asia Cups. Despite never meeting in an Asia Cup final, India holds a superior head-to-head record, winning 10 of 18 matches against Pakistan.

title: Woman tied up, stabbed to death by 2 domestic helps in Hyderabad flat
content: In Kukatpally, Hyderabad, a shocking incident occurred where a 50-year-old woman was murdered in her apartment by two domestic helpers. The perpetrators, after tying up and stabbing Renu Agarwal, stole gold jewelry and cash. They fled the scene on a two-wheeler, prompting a police manhunt to apprehend them, with suspicion pointing towards Ranchi as a possible escape destination.

title: Raipur airport navigation system fails, flights hit; hundreds of passengers stranded
content: Flight operations at Raipur's Swami Vivekananda Airport faced disruptions on Thursday morning due to a navigation system malfunction, leading to flight cancellations and passenger inconvenience. Airport Director KK Lahre confirmed the technical glitch, with operational work underway to resolve the issue. A passenger, Shantanu Chakraborthy, expressed frustration over his cancelled flight to Kolkata, highlighting the widespread disruption.

title: 'Progress being made': Govt says India-US trade deal likely by Nov; Trump-Modi signal thaw
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced that the initial phase of the trade agreement between India and the United States is expected to be finalized by November 2025. Discussions are progressing positively, with both sides expressing satisfaction, he said.

title: Sunjay Kapur’s sister accuses Priya Kapur of taking everything
content: Karisma Kapoor's children are seeking their share of their late father Sunjay Kapur's estate in the Delhi High Court, escalating a family dispute. Sunjay's sister accuses his widow of seizing everything, leaving their mother without resources. The court has ordered a full asset disclosure, with the next hearing scheduled for October 9 to potentially resolve the inheritance dispute.

title: Asia Cup: Suryakumar better captain than Rohit, Kohli, Dhoni - numbers prove it
content: India dominated UAE in their Asia Cup opener, securing a nine-wicket victory after Kuldeep Yadav's exceptional spin bowling dismantled the hosts for a mere 57 runs. India chased down the target swiftly in just 4.3 overs. Kuldeep Yadav's impressive figures of 4 for 7 led the bowling attack, supported by Shivam Dube's career-best 3/4.

title: Beast mauls, MP woman strikes back: 65-year-old strangles Jackal with sari
content: Surajia Bai Jatav, a 65-year-old woman from Madhya Pradesh, bravely fought off a jackal that attacked her in her field. The fierce encounter lasted for thirty minutes, during which she strangled the animal to death with her sari.

title: India says Switzerland's remarks against it at UNHRC 'surprising, shallow, and ill-informed'
content: Mr. Tyagi said it is all the more important for Switzerland to avoid wasting the Council's time with narratives that are blatantly false and do not do justice to the reality of India

title: Math made fun: how Madras Dyslexia Association’s toolkit helps children with dyscalculia
content: Launched in July, the MDA has introduced a toolkit titled ‘Count on Me’, designed primarily to support children with dyscalculia, a learning disability that affects the ability to understand numbers, arithmetic, and mathematical concepts

title: Elgar Parishad case: Accused Ramesh Gaichor released on temporary bail; jail authority apologises to Bombay High Court for delay
content: The jail superintendent also submitted an affidavit, tendering an unconditional apology for not complying with the High Court order, which delayed the activist's release

title: Sixteen Maoists surrender in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur
content: “All of them were lower rung cadres belonging to various units, including the Janatana Sarkar, Chetna Natya Mandli and panchayat militia members of Maoists,” an official said

title: Andhra Pradesh Government will acquire 5,000 acres for IT parks in Vizianagaram: Collector B.R. Ambedkar
content: Collector B.R. Ambedkar and other officials recently visited the airport region and observed that around 754 acres of land is readily available for the IT parks

title: Even in loss, Keralite Isaac George’s heart beats on to give hope to another
content: After untimely death from accident, his heart to be flown by air ambulance to a hospital in Kochi where it will be transplanted in a 28-year-old who has been on the waiting list for heart under Kerala government’s organ donation programme Mrithasanjeevani

title: ‘Match should go on’: Supreme Court refuses urgent listing of plea against India-Pakistan Asia Cup match
content: The plea contended that staging the match in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor is “against national interest”

title: Country going through era of cultural renaissance: Culture Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat
content: In his address, Gajendra Singh Shekhawat also  said that technology can help in translating "our manuscript heritage into AI-readable format" for greater dissemination

title: Withdraw ‘trade embargo’, Manipur govt. urges Naga body ahead of PM’s visit
content: The United Naga Council enforced the embargo in protest against the Centre’s move to fence the India-Myanmar border

title: Ramadoss removes son Anbumani from PMK’s primary membership; K. Balu says decision ‘invalid’
content: Mr. Anbumani can start his own party now that he has been expelled from the PMK, said the party founder; however, K. Balu, a key confidante of Mr. Anbumani, said Mr. Ramadoss’ announcement defied the party’s bylaws

title: Telangana-based self-taught artist with muscular dystrophy makes celebrity sketches
content: I don’t want people to show pity or like my art due to limitations says Swetha Eepuri, who wants her art to speak for her

title: Brain-eating amoeba: Kerala reports sixth amoebic meningoencephalitis death in a month
content: The deceased, a resident of Chelembra in Malappuram, had been undergoing treatment at Kozhikode MCH for over a week. The source of the infection is unclear

title: A new wave of drone pilots are turning Kerala’s natural charm into viral visual poetry
content: A growing community of drone photographers are re-imagining the state’s stunning landscape like never before

title: Savarkar’s grandnephew seeks Rahul Gandhi’s presence in court over withdrawn ‘threat’ plea
content: Savarkar’s grandnephew moves Pune court, seeking affidavit and personal countersignature on every filing in the defamation case

title: Bayana MLA Ritu Banawat among people from Rajasthan stranded in Nepal
content: Assembly Speaker Vasudev Devnani said in the House on the Monsoon session’s last day on Wednesday that the State government was making efforts for Ms. Banawat’s safe return

title: Don’t create OBC vs Maratha divide in society, says Chandrashekhar Bawankule
content: OBC leader and NCP Minister Chhagan Bhujbal objected to the word “Maratha” used in the GR, which is “vague” and may impact OBC reservation adversely

title: Odisha Cabinet approves creation of new modern city within Bhubaneswar
content: Surbana Jurong Infrastructure Private Limited, a Singapore-based global urban, infrastructure and managed services consulting firm, has been roped in for consultancy service

title: Supreme Court stays direction to GMR chairperson to vacate farmhouse
content: In April 2020, 2.45 acres of the property, including the main house, were leased to DIAL and other GMR affiliates at a monthly rent of ₹39.6 lakh, which was later revised to ₹45.6 lakh.

title: Fire guts section of Thiruvananthapuram Corporation’s material collection facility
content: According to information from Kazhakuttam fire station, the blaze began around 4 a.m. from the area where plastic waste was stored in large quantities

title: Bombay HC pulls up Savitribai Phule Pune University for circular allowing failed students direct promotion
content: The Bombay High Court has sought an explanation from Savitribai Phule Pune University over a “shocking” circular that allows failed students to be promoted to higher years.

title: ED searches across five States in alleged fake Input Tax Credit case
content: Last month, the agency had searched 12 locations in Jharkhand, West Bengal, and Maharashtra in connection with another case linked to fake GST invoices, as part of the probe under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

title: PUCL Maharashtra slams cabinet-approved labour law amendments, calls them ‘regressive’
content: PUCL Maharashtra said the move would legalise exploitative 12-hour shifts and shrink the organised workforce.

title: Ministry of External Affairs in touch with Russia to bring back Indians caught in battlefield
content: The Hindu reported that at least 15 Indian nationals are caught in the battlefield in Ukraine, where they are being forced to serve on the Russian side

title: Presidential Reference hearing highlights: Governor has power to examine constitutionality of the Bill, says AG
content: Tushar Mehta counters senior advocate Arvind Datar’s submission that Governor has no discretion but to assent even if a Bill was void

title: Passengers deplaned from Air India’s Singapore-bound plane at Delhi airport due to faulty air conditioning system
content: Video clips shared on social media showed passengers using newspapers and magazines to fan themselves.

title: Hyderabad traffic study reveals fourfold rise of four-wheelers and 40% dip in use of buses between 2011 and 2024
content: The urban development giant has commissioned a study to understand the shift in modes of transport over the years, towards preparation of a comprehensive mobility plan (CMP) as a prelude to the Master Plan for Hyderabad Metropolitan area

title: Scientists develop designer clownfish
content: The research findings were published in an article by scientists Ajith Kumar T.T. and P. R Divya at the Centre for Peninsular Aquatic Genetic Resources, which is part of NBFGR, Kochi, in the journal Current Science.

title: Secunderabad Cantonment Board residents air grievances, seek welfare benefits at ‘Cantonment Vani’
content: The programme included officials from several departments such as Revenue, Civil Supply, Electricity, Health, Police and Forest, alongside representatives from the SCB.

title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat dedicated entire life to social change: PM Modi
content: Mr Bhagwat’s tenure will be considered the most transformative period in the 100-year journey of the RSS, says PM

title: Why competitive exam aspirants are flocking to study spaces in Chennai
content: As you walk through Anna Nagar, you will find a private study hall on nearly every corner, offering a permanent reserved seat to any aspirant for a monthly fee. These packed spaces have become the go-to individual study spots for many students.

title: Orange Line may be delayed by a year as double-decker flyovers planned
content: According to BMRCL officials, Phase 3 will consist of two corridors—Corridor 1 spanning 32.15 km from J.P. Nagar Phase 4 to Kempapura, and Corridor 2 covering 12.5 km from Hosahalli to Kadabagere

title: Burglars decamp with goods worth ₹ 10 lakh from nine shops in Tirupattur
content: Shopkeepers found that burglars had also damaged CCTV cameras in the shops and took away the hard disk with them.

title: Organ donation: Authorisation Committees reconstituted in T.N., to examine link between donor and recipient
content: A committee that conducted an inquiry into the illegal kidney donations and transplants involving donors in Pallipalayam, Namakkal, had recommended that Authorisation Committees be reconstituted

title: Physiotherapists not entitled to use the ‘Dr.’ prefix
content: The prefix is reserved for registered medical practitioners, the Director General of Health Services said

title: State ropes in firms from Karnataka to set up shop in Hosur
content: Tamil Nadu’s Hosur attracts major investments from Karnataka-based companies, boosting job creation and strengthening the state’s economy.

title: Raghubar Das alleges Hemant Soren government of doing politics of appeasement
content: Mr. Das alleged that Hemant Soren government does not want to give rights to the backward classes by not allowing to hold municipal elections

title: West Bengal CM wants Indo-Bhutan River Commission with Bengal as its member
content: In response to a question raised by Trinamool Congress Rajya Sabha MP Ritabrata Banerjee on August 11, 2025 the Ministry of Jal Shakti had informed  the Parliament that there is no such proposal under consideration to form an Indo-Bhutan River Commission.

title: Internal rumbling within BJD coming to fore in Odisha
content: Resignation of former BJD Rajya Sabha MP and south Odisha strongman N. Bhaskar Rao is considered a jolt to the regional party

title: Obesity surpassed underweight as the more prevalent form of malnutrition this year: UNICEF report
content: Ultra-processed food is increasingly replacing fruits, vegetables and protein at a time when nutrition plays a critical role in children’s growth, cognitive development and mental health, UNICEF Executive Director Catherine Russell said

title: Violence mars poll campaign in Assam’s Bodoland
content: Supporters of the United People’s Party Liberal and the Bodoland People’s Front clashed in the Baukhungri constituency

title: Tamil Nadu achieves further decline in Maternal Mortality Ratio
content: Tamil Nadu now has the second-lowest MMR (at 35) in the country, behind Kerala and Andhra Pradesh, both at 30, according to the Special Bulletin on Maternal Mortality in India 2021-2023

title: Barnwell: Who's the real team to beat in the AFC? Why Week 1 caused big questions
content: Are the Chiefs vulnerable? Will the Bills or Ravens take control? Or could another team emerge? Let's sort through a wide-open race to the AFC's No. 1 seed.

title: What we're hearing ahead of Week 2: Potential panic in Miami, latest on Giants, Jets QBs
content: Our insiders dove in on the aftermath of the Dolphins' disastrous opener, and both New York QB situations.

title: 49ers' Purdy unlikely to play, could miss weeks
content: 49ers quarterback Brock Purdy is "a long shot" to play against the Saints, coach Kyle Shanahan told reporters.

title: Lamar apologizes to fan but 'just chill next time'
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson apologized to the Buffalo Bills fan that he shoved in retaliation on Sunday night.

title: 4 arrested in connection with Pritchard shooting
content: Four people have been arrested in connection to the shooting of Florida State LB Ethan Pritchard, Florida Department of Law Enforcement Commissioner Mark Glass said Wednesday.

title: Skenes tops 200 K's as Pirates manage workload
content: Paul Skenes reached 203 strikeouts on the season, fanning eight Orioles batters in Pittsburgh's 2-1, 10-inning loss on Wednesday night.

title: Bolt 'not worried' today's stars will break records
content: Sprinting legend Usain Bolt said he looks at today's top sprinters and doesn't expect his world records in the 100 and 200 meters to be toppled anytime soon.

title: Chapman allows first hit since July 23 as A's win
content: Aroldis Chapman allowed his first hit since July 23, and the Athletics rallied in the ninth inning to beat the Boston Red Sox 5-4, avoiding a series sweep.

title: Sources: Cowboys' Bland (foot) could miss weeks
content: Cowboys cornerback DaRon Bland, who injured his right foot in Monday's practice, could be sidelined for a couple of weeks, sources told ESPN.

title: Wild GM: Don't want 'panic' over Kaprizov talks
content: Wild GM Bill Guerin responded to reports that Kirill Kaprizov turned down an NHL record contract extension, saying he was unsure how the information went public and adding, "We're working through things."
